intro: Eschscholzia arvensis var. orthodichasialis, commonly known as the orthodichasial poppy, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is characterized by its striking red to orange flowers and broad, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies. Its flowers bloom in early to mid-summer and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
